text: , also known as Special Case cities, is a defined class or category of Japanese cities. It is a local administrative division created by the national government.Web-Japan.org, "Local self-government," p. 3; retrieved 2012-11-28. All special cities have a population greater than 200,000. ==History== The special or special case cities were created because of the Local Autonomy Law of Japan.The special cities are not the same as the special wards of Tokyo. Each city does many of the things normally done by prefectures. ===List=== Special cities were recognized starting in 2000.Jacobs, A.J. "Japan's Evolving Nested Municipal Hierarchy: The Race for Local Power in the 2000s," Urban Studies Research, (2011); doi:10.1155/2011/692764; retrieved 2012-12-18.
